annual crop land: possibly farm equipment or irrigation systems
uniformity in the type of vegetation being grown
forest: natural elements like soil, rocks, and fallen leaves
varying shades of green leaves or foliage
presence of underbrush or ground vegetation
pattern of light and shadow due to the canopy above
brushland or shrubland: often situated in arid or semi-arid regions
sparse or scattered distribution of shrubs or small trees
limited or irregular patches of taller plants
highway or road: lane markings, such as white or yellow lines
industrial buildings or commercial build: HVAC systems or other industrial equipment visible on the roof
smokestacks or silos (indicative of an industrial facility)
pasture land: Presence of grazing animals such as cows, sheep, or horses
Often divided by hedgerows, ditches, or other natural boundaries
Sometimes includes a barn or a shelter for animals
Bright and airy, often with clear skies
permanent crop land: signs of agricultural activity such as machinery or workers
presence of structures like trellises or supports
rows or patterns of planted crops
residential buildings or homes or apartm: multiple floors for apartments or multi-level homes
walls with siding, brick, or other exterior finishes
river: Meandering or winding path through the landscape
Various shades of blue, green, or brown
Sometimes animals or people interacting with the water
lake or sea: reflections of the sky or surrounding landscape
waves or ripples on the surface
varying shades of blue or green
